contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|stardust}} '''Stardust''' may refer to: * A type of [[Cosmic dust#Stardust|cosmic dust]] composed of particles in space {{tocright}} ==Music== * [[Stardust (band)]] * "Stardust", a song by Galneryus from ''[[Reincarnation (Galneryus album)|Reincarnation]] * [[Stardust (song)|"Stardust" (song)]], by Hoagy Carmichael * "Stardust" (song), by [[David Essex]] * [[Stardust (Lena Meyer-Landrut song)|"Stardust" (Lena Meyer-Landrut song)]], by Lena Meyer-Landrut * [[Stardust (Willie Nelson album)|''Stardust'' (Willie Nelson album)]] * ''[[Stardust: The Great American Songbook, Volume III]]'' (album), by Rod Stewart * [[Stardust (John Coltrane album)|''Stardust'' (John Coltrane album)]], 1963 * [[Stardust (Natalie Cole album)|''Stardust'' (Natalie Cole album)]], 1996 * [[Stardust (Lena album)|''Stardust'' (Lena album)]], 2012 * ''Stardust â€“ A musical flashback in time'', a 2007 [[Grand Theatre, Swansea|Swansea Grand Theatre]] show about 30 years of musical history * [[Stardust (radio format)]] * [[Alvin Stardust]] (born 1942), English pop singer and stage actor * "Stardust", a song by Mika from ''[[The Origin of Love]]'' * "Stardust", a song by Amaranthe from ''[[The Nexus (album)|The Nexus]]'' ==Books and magazines== * [[Stardust (novel)|''Stardust'' (novel)]], a 1998 fantasy novel by Neil Gaiman * [[Stardust (magazine)|''Stardust'' (magazine)]] * ''Stardust'', a 1990 novel in the [[Spenser (character)|Spenser]] series by Robert B. Parker * [[Stardust (Bruce Serafin memoirs)]], a posthumous collection of memoirs and essays that received the 2008 Edna Staebler Award for Creative Non-Fiction * ''Stardust'', a fantasy book series about unicorns by [[Linda Chapman]] ==Film and television== * [[Stardust (2007 film)|''Stardust'' (2007 film)]], adapted from the Neil Gaiman novel * [[Stardust (1974 film)|''Stardust'' (1974 film)]], by Michael Apted * [[Stardust (Space: Above and Beyond episode)|"Stardust" (''Space: Above and Beyond'' episode)]] * [[Star Dust (film)|''Star Dust'' (film)]], a 1940 film directed by Walter Lang * [[Stardust (TV miniseries)|''Stardust'' (TV miniseries)]], Irish miniseries about the Stardust fire; see below * ''Stardust One'', the one-man capsule of US Air Force astronaut captain Tony Nelson in Episode 1 of the television series ''[[I Dream of Jeannie]]'' ==Comics== * [[Stardust the Super Wizard]], a Fox Comics superhero first appearing in 1939 * [[Stardust (AC Comics)]], a superhero first appearing in 1983 * [[Stardust (Marvel Comics)]], a character first appearing in 2005, one of the Heralds to Galactus ==Other uses== * [[Stardust (spacecraft)]], a NASA mission to investigate the comet Wild 2 * [[Stardust@home]], a citizen science project * [[Stardust (video game)|''Stardust'' (video game)]] * [[Star Dust (aircraft)|''Star Dust'' (aircraft)]], a British airliner that disappeared in 1947 * [[Stardust International Raceway]], Las Vegas, Nevada * [[Stardust Promotion]], a talent management firm * [[Stardust Resort and Casino]], Las Vegas, Nevada * [[Stardust Speed Club]], an inline speed skating team * [[Stardust fire]], a fatal 1981 fire in a Dublin nightclub * [[Stardust Circus]], a travelling circus, Australia ==See also== * [[Space dust (disambiguation)]] * [[Ziggy Stardust (disambiguation)]] * [[Starlight (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
